name: Creating a Pre-Auth Request
description: Walkthrough on creating a Pre-Authenticated Request.

steps.message: Object storage offers secure way to share buckets and objects. Pre-Authenticated Requests allow users to access Object Storage without own credentials or API keys. Tip: Bucket Pre-Authenticated requests can be used to create objects in the bucket. With this request, you cannot read from or list the objects in the bucket.

Click the menu button on top left. Scroll down to "Object Storage" and click "Object Storage".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/objmenu.png}}

Click on the menu for the bucket to create a Pre-Authenticated requests. This will give you the option to create a Pre-Auth for the bucket itself.
Tip:If you add a object name you can do a Pre-Authenticated request for a specific object. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/objpreauth.png}}

Click on the "Create Pre-Authenticated Requests" and Apply a name that will show in the Oracle Console. For Bucket requests, select the bucket as a target. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/objpreauth2.png}} Tip: You can have Pre-Authenticated Requests to expire after a certain date.
A window will show displaying the Pre-Auth URI. Copy and save this for your records and use! </br> {{img-url:/images/tutorials/objpreauth3.png}}

To create secure access to a specific object in a bucket, you can also create Pre-Auth to specific object. </br> When viewing the Bucket information scroll to find your specific object under Objects menu. Click on the menu options for the object then click on Create Pre-Authenticated request. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/objpreauth4.png}}

The object name should be auto filled. You can give the Pre-Auth a friendly name. </br> For access type you can specify type from Read, Write, or both Read & Write. As well as expiration date. </br> Click on Create. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/objpreauth4.png}}

A window will show displaying the Pre-Auth URI. Copy and save this for your records and use as well. This link will allow users direct access to specific objects only. </br> {{img-url:/images/tutorials/objpreauth3.png}}

To view Pre-Authenticated Requests previously created. In the bucket information click on Pre-Authenticated requests. </br> Here you can manage the requests and view information. {{img-url:/images/tutorials/objpreauth5.png}}

Congrats! Now you know how to create secure access to object storage buckets and objects.
Pre-Authenticated request will work while the user who created the requests has access or till the expiration date!
For more information on Pre-Authenticated request go to the documentation
